text:
Using Linux 2.4.20-8bigmem #1 SMP i686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux (RedHat 9)...

As soon as I run './configure --prefix=/usr/local/apache' I get:

: bad interpreter: No such file or directory

This is a new installation, no previous apache version or package exists on this
host. I am running as root with permissions opened up on the untarred directory
tree.

Have you checked the download was not corrupt?  Does "md5sum httpd-2.0.48.tar.gz"
give this output:

466c63bb71b710d20a5c353df8c1a19c  httpd-2.0.48.tar.gz

Otherwise: check the configure script is executable, try "sh ./configure", or
post the results of "sh -x ./configure" if you really can't get it working.

text:
Ah, that happens if you've done Unix->DOS newline conversion on the configure
script.  Have you untarred on an SMB mount or something like that?  Untar on a
local filesystem and use "tar xzf" not anything else to unpack the tarball.

No, the archive was sent [ftp/bin] directly from donwload to the linux box and
it was unzipped/untarred using xvf...

But now that you've identified the issue, I can see \r\n's when I od -c the
file... I have no idea how they got there.

I will reattempt the download from scratch....
